result.execSummary:
The defendant Belinda C Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
12/02/16 AMENDED - COURT GRANTS HUBER. 
12/30/16 AMENDED TO ADD 8 ADDITIONAL DAYS CREDIT FROM 56 DAYS TO 64 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday, September 16, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
Must pay $400.00 in extradition fees owed to the Child Support Agency. The cash bond of $500.00 in 14CF256 and the cash bond of $3500.00 in 15CF233 for a cash bond total of  $4000.00 is to be paid to the District Attorney's Trust Fund. The District Attorney's Office with make payment to the Child Support Agency for Child Support Arrears. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain full time employment. 
If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work at 5 places per week and submit a monthly report to the Child Support Agency and to Probation.
Must pay child support in full and on time through WI SCTF.
09/18/2015 CORRECTED TO ADD: MUST REPORT CHANGE OF EMPLOYMENT OR ADDRESS WITHIN 48 HOURS TO THE CHILD SUPPORT AGENCY AND THE PROBATION AGENCY.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Belinda C Lewis in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF233 and 14CF256. State relates agreement.
15CF233 - State moves to dismiss and read in. Court orders this case be dismissed and read-in.
14CF256 - State moves to amend both counts to 948.22(3). Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty to both counts. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty of both counts.
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court.

Court relates and orders:
90 days jail on each count - consecutive. Credit for 56 days on count 1 if revoked.  - STAYED

2 years probation - IMPOSED. Must report by 9/16/15 by 3:00 PM.
Must pay child support in full and on time through WI SCTF
Must maintain full time employment.
If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work at 5 places per week and submit a monthly report to the probation agent and child support agency.
Must report change of employment of address within 48 hours to the child support agency and probation officer.
Must pay $400.00 in extradition fees owed to the Child Support Agency.
$4000.00 cash bond is to be paid to the District Attorney's Trust Fund. The District Attorney's Office will make payment to the Child Support Agency for Child Support Arrears.
Costs.

Clerked by WH
